title: What is the oldest technology that can't be improved upon? - Quora

response.answer_text: Honey? Bees make it and men collect, filter, and package it but it’s nature and making haven’t changed in the time before man or primates were tool-users. Still great stuff as a sweetener, antibiotic wound dressing, food preservative, cosmeceutical (see Burt’s Bees), alcoholic beverage ingredient whether Mead or in beer, and other uses I’m forgetting. If you know honey, you know molasses, brown sugar, granulated sugar, stevia, aspartame, saccharin, maple syrup, corn syrup, malt barley syrup, carmelized sugar, etc. aren’t substitutes for it and only “improvements” in particular blending qualities or comparatively cheaper and easier to make.
Well, I will through my hat in the ring and say the wheel. More so for what it symbolizes! Perpetual motion! Not only for finding the fulcrum point, but perpetuating it ad finitum!
